alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Laramie Valley; Shirley Basin; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued November 04 at 1:45PM MDT until November 05 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM MDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Southwest winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 65 mph possible. * WHERE...Ferris/Seminoe/Shirley Mountains, Shirley Basin, Central Carbon County, Laramie Valley, South Laramie Range and South Laramie Range Foothills. * WHEN...From 9 PM MDT Friday to 6 PM MDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Widespread strong crosswinds could create hazardous travel for all motorists on Interstate 80 and north to south oriented highways such as Highway 287...especially for light weight and high profile vehicles...including light load semis and those towing camper trailers.
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive.

area.areaDesc: Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Laramie Valley; Shirley Basin; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills; Upper North Platte River Basin
